descr: "An interaction between a patient and healthcare provider(s) for the purpose of providing healthcare service(s) or assessing the health status of a patient."

fields.name: resourceType
fields.descr: "This is a Encounter resource"

fields.name: identifier
fields.descr: "Identifier(s) by which this encounter is known."

fields.name: status
fields.descr: "planned | arrived | triaged | in-progress | onleave | finished | cancelled +."

fields.name: _status
fields.descr: "Extensions for status"

fields.name: statusHistory
fields.descr: "The status history permits the encounter resource to contain the status history without needing to read through the historical versions of the resource, or even have the server store them."

fields.name: FHIRclass
fields.descr: "inpatient | outpatient | ambulatory | emergency +."

fields.name: classHistory
fields.descr: "The class history permits the tracking of the encounters transitions without needing to go  through the resource history.\n\nThis would be used for a case where an admission starts of as an emergency encounter, then transisions into an inpatient scenario. Doing this and not restarting a new encounter ensures that any lab/diagnostic results can more easily follow the patient and not require re-processing and not get lost or cancelled during a kindof discharge from emergency to inpatient."

fields.name: type
fields.descr: "Specific type of encounter (e.g. e-mail consultation, surgical day-care, skilled nursing, rehabilitation)."

fields.name: priority
fields.descr: "Indicates the urgency of the encounter."

fields.name: subject
fields.descr: "The patient ro group present at the encounter."

fields.name: episodeOfCare
fields.descr: "Where a specific encounter should be classified as a part of a specific episode(s) of care this field should be used. This association can facilitate grouping of related encounters together for a specific purpose, such as government reporting, issue tracking, association via a common problem.  The association is recorded on the encounter as these are typically created after the episode of care, and grouped on entry rather than editing the episode of care to append another encounter to it (the episode of care could span years)."

fields.name: incomingReferral
fields.descr: "The referral request this encounter satisfies (incoming referral)."

fields.name: participant
fields.descr: "The list of people responsible for providing the service."

fields.name: appointment
fields.descr: "The appointment that scheduled this encounter."

fields.name: period
fields.descr: "The start and end time of the encounter."

fields.name: length
fields.descr: "Quantity of time the encounter lasted. This excludes the time during leaves of absence."

fields.name: reason
fields.descr: "Reason the encounter takes place, expressed as a code. For admissions, this can be used for a coded admission diagnosis."

fields.name: diagnosis
fields.descr: "The list of diagnosis relevant to this encounter."

fields.name: account
fields.descr: "The set of accounts that may be used for billing for this Encounter."

fields.name: hospitalization
fields.descr: "Details about the admission to a healthcare service."

fields.name: location
fields.descr: "List of locations where  the patient has been during this encounter."

fields.name: serviceProvider
fields.descr: "An organization that is in charge of maintaining the information of this Encounter (e.g. who maintains the report or the master service catalog item, etc.). This MAY be the same as the organization on the Patient record, however it could be different. This MAY not be not the Service Delivery Location's Organization."

fields.name: partOf
fields.descr: "Another Encounter of which this encounter is a part of (administratively or in time)."
